author: Andrew Tangel
title: Manufacturers Aim to Blunt Tariff Pain
text:
As manufacturers scramble to prepare for the start of U.S. tariffs on imported steel and aluminum this Friday, one business group is appealing to President Donald Trump with an ad purchase on shows he is known to watch: “Fox & Friends” and “Hannity.”
The Association of Equipment Manufacturers, which represents makers of construction and agricultural equipment, said it has launched a commercial for the Washington, D.C., area to persuade the president to reverse course. In the ad, factory workers read out: “Thanks to you,...
